Summary: dancing, stationary, zig-zagging white lights in southwest sky
divs: Sighting DetailsLast night we were observing lunar eclipse from in front of our house. After all of the recent events in Stephenville and after reading that the Mexican Air Force observed ufos through their infra-red cameras, I decided to try the infra-red camera that my husband has in his work as an engineering test pilot. I pointed the camera toward the southwest sky. We live in Burleson, close to Joshua on acreage. There were intermittent clouds. At first we thought the bright, white lights were meteors.But meteors obey the laws of physics. We observed these lights, usually one or two at a time, zig-zag, some just stopped then changed direction,some made spiral movements and one moved in circles, some just seemed to zip through the sky upward or downward,like a game of ping pong. My three daughters also observed this on the 8 in x 8 in. screen for the infra-red camera. Soon it was too cloudy to see and it was about 10 p.m. We will try again another night when the clouds go away. My husband is going to connect the camera to a video-recorder and tripod. Has anyone else seen the same thing using infra-red. It was compelling!
